knimeNode.name: Database Reader
knimeNode.shortDescription: Establishes and opens a database access connection to read a table from.

fullDescription.intro:
Establishes and opens a database access connection to read data from.
Make sure you have your vendor-specific database driver registered in the KNIME preference page (section Database Driver). By default, the sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver (Windows and Linux) is only available.
fullDescription.option: Enter the database driver here; it is a Java class (including the package path), for example: sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver Additional driver can be registered via KNIME's preference page (Database Driver).
Enter the database name here, for example jdbc:odbc:database_name or jdbc:mysql://host:port/database_name

If checked, the credentials (user and password) are used as defined on the workflow. The credential name links to the specified user and password. Those can be replaced or edit using the 'Workflow Credentials' menu available in the workflow context menu.
Your log-in user name for the database.
Your log-in password for the database. Note, the password is de- and encrypted before handling it internally.
Enter SQL statement being execute here, for example SELECT * FROM table
The SQL query is execute as it is without accessing the meta info from the database during configure which result in an empty spec after configure.

The list contains the flow variables that are currently available at the node input. Double clicking any of the entries will insert the respective identifier at the current cursor position (replacing the selection, if any).

ports.outPort: Table with data read from the database
